qas.question: What did CCTV-1 host on the evening of May 18th?

answers.text: four-hour program called The Giving of Love

qas.question: Who was the show hosted by?
How large were the donations from the program?

answers.text: Donations of the evening totalled 1.5 billion Chinese Yuan

qas.question: How much did Jackie Chan donate to support?
What was the name of the music video that Jackie Chan made for the event?
What was the program that CCTV-1 hosted?
What did the donations total for the program?
How much did actor Jackie Chan donate?
What was the name of Chan's music video?

context: On the evening of May 18, <a7_0>CCTV<a7_0/>-1 hosted a special <a0_0>four-hour program called <a5_0>The Giving of Love<a5_0/><a0_0/> (simplified Chinese: 爱的奉献; traditional Chinese: 愛的奉獻), hosted by regulars from the CCTV New Year's Gala and round-the-clock coverage anchor <a1_0>Bai Yansong<a1_0/>. It was attended by a wide range of entertainment, literary, business and political figures from mainland China, Hong Kong, Singapore and Taiwan. <a2_0>Donations of the evening totalled 1.5 billion Chinese Yuan<a2_0/> (~<a6_0>US$208 million<a6_0/>). Of the donations, CCTV gave the biggest corporate contribution at ¥50 million. Almost at the same time in Taiwan, a similarly themed programme was on air hosted by the sitting president Ma Ying-jeou. In June, Hong Kong actor Jackie Chan, who donated <a3_0>$<a8_0>1.57 million<a8_0/><a3_0/> to the victims, made a music video alongside other artists entitled "<a4_0><a9_0>Promise<a9_0/><a4_0/>"; the song was composed by Andy Lau. The Artistes 512 Fund Raising Campaign, an 8-hour fundraising marathon, was held on June 1 in Hong Kong; it was attended by some 200 Sinosphere musicians and celebrities. In Singapore, MediaCorp Channel 8 hosted a 'live' programme 让爱川流不息 to raise funds for the victims.
